title: Impact of online harassment and abuse on female victims 2017
summary: The chart shows the Impact online Response in terms of the Share of respondents with Less_able_to_focus_on_everyday_tasks having the Impact – 66 respondents down to Not_being_able_to_sleep_well the least online of the group at 36 respondents .

In between , we have A_feeling_of_powerlessness_in_my_ability_to_respond_to_abuse_or_harassment_online 66 , Less_able_to_make_day-to-day_decisions 36 , A_feeling_of_apprehension_when_thinking_about_using_the_internet_or_social_media 58 and Lower_self-esteem_or_a_loss_of_self_confidence 61 .

data.Response: A feeling of powerlessness in my ability to respond to abuse or harassment online
Not being able to sleep well
Lower self-esteem or a loss of self confidence
A feeling of apprehension when thinking about using the internet or social media
Less able to focus on everyday tasks
Experiencing panic attacks anxiety or stress
A feeling of isolation or a need to withdraw into yourself
A feeling of apprehension when receiving emails or social media notifications
Not being able to accomplish what you usually would on a typical day
Being unable to concentrate for long periods of time
Less able to make day-to-day decisions

gold: This statistic presents data on the psychological impact of women experiencing online abuse or harassment worldwide . During the July 2017 survey period , 66 percent of survey respondents who have experienced online abuse stated that they felt a feeling of powerlessness in their ability to respond to abuse or harassment online . A total of 63 percent of online harassment victims also reported to not being able to sleep well .
